website_summaries.verdict: This is your best bet if you like to stargaze from different locations and you're looking for something that's easily portable.
pros: Astronomy software with celestial object database included
cons: Users have complained about the sturdiness of the telescope's tripod

customer_reviews.title: Amazing telescope for such a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dad and based off the high quality of the telescope, he thought I paid a crazy amount for it! It comes in a nice little backpack and there is even a little extra room to put other stuff in there as well. I didn’t take a picture of the whole thing put together but it is wonderful! The quality is so amazing and the price is such a steal for the quality. If you’ve read this far and if this review helped at all, please click “helpful”!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis A.

customer_reviews.title: Works as a guidescope
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as a guide scope for my SCT. It works fine for that purpose. Probably not as good as a purpose made guidescope, but a good economical alternative. The attached photo was taken while guiding with this scope.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Great for staring at the moon 🌘
customer_reviews.text: Great little telescope for checking out the moon, haven't really tried doing anything else with it though. Bought mine last August and have had lots of fun with it since then. I use my iPhone to take pictures through the lense and have gotten some great shots.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Using Panasonic Gx85
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make a lens out of it and guess what. It's done. Here are some pictures I got with it. Love it. Using Panasonic Gx85.
customer_reviews.author: Rihass

customer_reviews.title: No need to fly to the moon
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a steal! Got this telescope for my grandfather for his birthday. He is outside a lot on the patio at night and always watches the stars so I figured it was time to give him, what he never knew, he always wanted. A great beginner scope! After focusing the scope properly and taking a glance at the moon it almost feels like you could reach out and grab it. Wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: DrHanSoloMDTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Yes it can!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this telescope for only one reason, I wanted to see Saturn's rings with my own eyes, not a photograph. I thought I was taking a chance because it is so compact but not only did I see the rings, they were as clear as all the photos I've seen of them. The view surpassed what I was expecting from such a modestly priced telescope. I'm very pleased (and yes, the other reviews are correct about the tripod being cheap and flimsy but not a deal breaker).
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are absolutely horrible! We’re pretty positive that we’re missing pieces. I have looked up every video and searched every website. We still cannot get this to work properly. We’re extremely upset because our daughter wanted this telescope so desperately! It was her birthday gift! She can’t even use it!
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Professional telescope instead
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Cheap plastic design and plastic lenses. TERRIBLE PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Marti Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Can't really see anything clear enough
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought this as an anniversary gift because of a big trip across the country we were taking as a family. For that reason, by the time we used it the item was passed the return date. Here's the basics on this telescope: Pros: Lightweight, easy to assemble, compact. Cons: Other than viewing things really close up you can't really see anything. You can't expand out far enough to get a clear view of planets, stars, astroids, or comets (which we had passing us in 2 locations this summer). I was able to view things better with our binoculars than with this telescope. Totally bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Momma2*3

customer_reviews.title: The tripod does feel flimsy like some other reviewers have said
customer_reviews.text: We love this! The tripod does feel flimsy like some other reviewers have said, but that’s really it. The rest of the telescope exceeds my expectations of one that costs less than $100. The attached picture is of the super moon from January 1, 2018. I held my phone up to the telescope and took it. Not too shabby.
customer_reviews.author: Krysteen

customer_reviews.title: Cracked on the 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: I’m so disappointed. We pulled this out for the second time since buying it and it’s broken! The screw in the handle penetrated a piece plastic, cracking it, and now the telescope won’t stay upward. It just keeps flopping downward. Of course I’m only a few days past the turn window. I would recommend investing in something a little nicer, I guess. We are going to try to fix it, but right now I’m so frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Krista B

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars for this Telescope
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, as described and packaged perfectly, It comes with a backpack that you can use to store or easily transport the telescope. This was a gift for a 10 year old just beginning to be curious with the night sky. Great "bonding" activity, and we are learning as we go. We also purchased the Celestron Sky Maps book, which we would recommend if you are just beginning the star gazing adventure. Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Kalli Webb

customer_reviews.title: Good telecope!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for my friend's telescope. I borrowed this exact telescope from my friend, and he already misplaced the tripod for it, and I borrowed it for a while and lost some of the pieces for it. Instead of buying the separate replacement pieces for it, I decided it was cheaper to just buy a new telescope all together. It seems to work just fine, my friend has posted of photos of it being used, staring at the moon. and I briefly used it despite it not having a tripod. It's good quality for it's price and convenience.
customer_reviews.author: xsheenah!

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift, and I am very happy with it! The moon is sharp and clear once I can find it, and I can see Saturn and it's rings. Jupiter and its 4 Galilean are also visible and crisp. The tripod is a bit unstable, but it is usable. I bought a moon filter, a 4mm eyepiece, and a 5x Barlow lens to enhance viewing. The telescope is amazing and inexpensive. I definetely would recommend. 5/5
customer_reviews.author: D. Sandstrom

customer_reviews.title: as a beginner and incredibly amateur astronomer i love this telescope
customer_reviews.text: as a beginner and incredibly amateur astronomer i love this telescope, it's easy to set up and simple to operate, just find the celestial object you want with the finder-scope then enjoy your view, this is not a high powered telescope so you won't get sharp images of distant objects, it's perfect for viewing constellations, the moon and nearby planets but not so great for dim nebulae and galaxies
customer_reviews.author: MSK

customer_reviews.title: Was expecting better quality and clearer views of the night sky
customer_reviews.text: Was expecting better quality and clearer views of the night sky. I recommend saving your money for a higher priced better quality product. Returned product.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of this at all. We cannot ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of this at all. We cannot even get it to focus after hours of trying to look at the moon. Even took it to someone that moon gazes recreationally and he could not get it to focus out. its very unstable on the tripod too.
customer_reviews.author: TJR

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. We got this for our daughter for Christmas. The lens doesn’t even focus, she is so disappointed. DO NOT BUY THIS! Amazon won’t even let us return the product without paying $70! Ugh! This feels like such a scam. Your money is better spent elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn Correll

customer_reviews.title: Great little telescope
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this telescope for about 1 year now and have really enjoyed it. I have been able to look at the moon, see the rings of Saturn and observed the different colored bands of gasses on Jupiter. Overall this has been a wonderful beginners telescope.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Telescope is good, tripod is not
customer_reviews.text: I used this telescope as part of my proposal to my fiance, who is obsessed with the moon. Neither of us has owned a telescope before, but the set up was pretty straight forward. The tripod is terrible. It wasnt stable, and didnt hold position well. The telescope itself was great for our skill level, and she said 'yes' so it worked for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Broken and/or missing
customer_reviews.text: We received a broken and used telescope. The manual was in terrible condition, the front lens was missing, and the bolt needed to attach the telescope to the tripod. We are slowly working on getting this fixed. I'll update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: Nice optics and accessories
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to look at the Neowise comet. However, we couldn’t find the comet where we live. We did see Jupiter and 3 of its moons. That was an amazing thing to see with the telescope. One thing to consider is to use a better tripod than the one included with this one. The included tripod is jumpy and makes it difficult to lock in the object in the viewfinder. The included backpack is very handy and we like the portability of this.
customer_reviews.author: L. Carter

customer_reviews.title: At least its a Celestron
customer_reviews.text: I really wouldn't consider it a "travel " telescope, although the best thing about it is the backpack that comes with it. I have a couple different spotting scopes and a nice Celestron 6SE telescope, so bear with me. Don't waste your money on this one, spend more for a better telescope, from Celestron. The rest of their product line is really good, but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Surprise! Surprise!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Celestron 70 telescope for my grandson who was interested in my astronomy hobby. I thought it a good starter for a kid. When it arrived I took a few minutes to assemble it and to try it out. OMG! I was amazed at what this little scope could do! Very clear optics and easy to use. Easy to see Saturn's rings, Jupiter's moons and the Moons surface. Simple? Yes, but is a perfect first telescope. I've paid thousands of dollars for high-end telescopes that were frustrating and difficult to use and got zero help from the manufacturers. For 75 bucks this little jewel rocks! highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 year old grandsons birthday. It was what he asked for and I did nt want to buy a children's version because I wanted to encourage his interest in astronomy. After 4 different attempts by 4 different adults, we still could not set up the telescope! The instructions were minimal, not clear at all. The few pictures in the booklet were unhelpful. This was definetly not meant for a beginner. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Beinhorn

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level scope
customer_reviews.text: This is a great entry level telescope. Be advised you likely won’t be able to really see anything beyond the moon, I think the description said you could see the rings of Saturn. I couldn’t see Venus much less Saturn however other than that slight over statement of its ability it’s a great little lightweight and easily portable telescope and I have thoroughly enjoyed it and consider a good bargain as well. Update... I stand corrected.. yes, you can in fact see the rings of Saturn as well as the moons of Jupiter. It won’t be HD but for the money it is an amazing buy.
customer_reviews.author: jim minnick

customer_reviews.title: Ametuer to telescopes
customer_reviews.text: I bough this as a started for my kid and I and couldn’t be happier. Yes it is not a top of the line and compare to high end tripods it’s the not sturdiest tripod as others notes. However it work excellent for a starter telescope. Very easy to set up and store. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Davis R. Best

customer_reviews.title: ... birthday based on the reviews that this is a great beginners telescope
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12 year old sons birthday based on the reviews that this is a great beginners telescope. He was so excited and immediately went outside to look at the moon- he was able to use the viewfinder and had the telescope focused in less than 5 minutes. The tripod is unstable which per other reviews we expected but all in all a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice, but tripod is nothing
customer_reviews.text: This is a superb little telescope. It is SO light and compact it's ridiculous. The image for this price point is VERY NICE. (meaning you will still get prism highlights on the edges of things like the moon). But the tripod is unusable in almost every sense. Whether you're trying to pan/tilt with it, OR hold it still on the farthest zoom lens, this tripod will jerk and wiggle on you making it TOTALLY unusable. I had to put it on a SUPER heavy tripod. That's why I took off a star on portability. Requiring an accessory to use a portable device removes its portability.
customer_reviews.author: Tex Wilbourn

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Only thing we an see is the moon, anything else looks like a dot!
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Sticky gel lubrication on the viewing sliding mechanism area, had to return. Every time my finger got anywhere near that area it got on my fingers, only a matter of time until I transferred it to a lens. Bad quality control. Wanted to set it up and love it, cloudy night so I really couldn't see anything to say how good it was.
customer_reviews.author: EM68

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 10-year old daughter. I have to say, it was easy to set up and take down. Works way better than any telescope than I had growing up. She seems to find it easy to operate. I do wish the tripod was a little higher and a little sturdier, but I ended up just using one of my camera tripods for the time being. Definitely cool for the budding astronomer though (and their parents). A friend of mine who is a bit more into it, said this was a decent portable telescope and is now thinking of getting one after checking this one out.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Redding

customer_reviews.title: Great value and features for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this telescope for our summer road-trip. Threw it into one of the cubby holes in our RV. It was very easy to set up, and stores nicely in the included and padded little backpack. It came in handy several times - looking at planets and the moon while at Lake Powell. Then during the eclipse, I covered the lenses with some solar viewing film, and the kids loved it! I wish it were a little stronger, but you can't beat the value and features for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Smedley

customer_reviews.title: not a telescope junkie, but I like it
customer_reviews.text: I got this as an upgrade to my folding telescope for watching ships passing by in the Sound. It works quite well for that. On clear days, I can even see clear across to the other side well enough to pick out meaningful features like houses & docks. The biggest downside of this telescope is now I want one with even *more* magnification XD
customer_reviews.author: ASCII Aardvark

customer_reviews.title: Definitely for beginners
customer_reviews.text: While this is a great way for beginners to start, the telescope is a bit flimsy and difficult to make easy adjustments. I got it for my 4 year old grandson and expect he may use it to look at the moon. Anything else you might be able to catch would be by luck only. If he shows an interest, I'll get him a better one when he's a little older. I'm afraid he may loose interest though because it is not really easy to use. It is great for portability and quick setup, just isn't stable enough to get the harder celestial objects to find in the night sky.
customer_reviews.author: Grumps

customer_reviews.title: I figured it would be a great way to get her off the digital screen and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my little sister, and she loves it. I figured it would be a great way to get her off the digital screen and onto something more "mind engaging." I showed her all of the constellations, and now she is thrilled every time she finds one. I do not regret a single thing about this purchase and has been a great investment for both my sister and I. 10/10 -A
customer_reviews.author: Aiden

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: If you want a telescope for one or two uses, this is a great purchase. It lasted for all of three weeks with really light use at our house - we would move it from our guest room to our patio maybe twice a week and the tripod base ended up breaking at one of its joints and can't hold the telescope in place anymore. We were excited to find an affordable telescope with such great reviews, but all it did was confirm the old idiom concerning prices.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Twinkle twinkle little star
customer_reviews.text: Good basic telescope There is a leveler on the tripod it takes some time to adjust. The backpack fits everting neatly with extra padding and velcro straps to stay secure. Small zipper pocket allows for personal lose items such as cards and keys. One of my new covid hobby is now stargazing. The universe is a crazy place. Right before the corn new moon, Saturn and Jupiter can be seen. Spotted mars Maybe not worth $90
customer_reviews.author: Hangrybear

customer_reviews.title: Great telescope
customer_reviews.text: I bought this telescope for my boyfriend for Christmas since he loves watching the meteor showers and anything astronomy. He said he had it built quickly and easily, just waiting on a nice night sky to look at the stars. I loved the added feature of the free app that you can download to know when certain meteor showers or constellations will be visible. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Imagine the possibilities
customer_reviews.text: My hubby and son where highly entertained looking at the moon last night and I was able to get this shot of the moon using my camera phone. So far I'm happy with it but I still have a lot more experiment to do with it when we eventually start traveling again. It was well priced for all that it is able to do.
customer_reviews.author: Asha M

customer_reviews.title: It didnt work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could of liked this item. I bought it for my nephew and we were very disappointed. Looked at the manual and looked at different youtube videos on how to assemble the telescope and we could not get it to work correctly. We could not see anything and we did everything to be able to try to see out of it. For an item that does not work it is not worth the money. I feel really stupid buying this item. I was really embarrassed about it. I got it for him for a christmas present so I couldnt it since I got it way before xmas.
customer_reviews.author: Ana De La Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Not easy
customer_reviews.text: So far we haven’t figured it out. We can’t get it to focus and feel it may have been a waste of money. Would return but the box got thrown out on Christmas. I wouldn’t recommend since we can’t even use it effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BLURRY AF!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed! Bought this for my son for Christmas and you can’t see crap!! It’s so blurry and hard to focus. I’ve tried over and over and over and I’m over it! I’ve decided to return it. Just REALLY disappointed. I really wanted to see what others are seeing in they reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa A.

customer_reviews.title: More of a toy than scientific instrument
customer_reviews.text: Understanding that a precision telescope would cost much more, I was still disappointed with this purchase based on the other reviews. Very cheap materials and finicky adjustments. Hoped 9 yr old kids would be able to use it on their own to explore the night sky, but it's so fragile and difficult to use that an adult has to set everything up and dial it in before kids look. Would be better off spending $100 on a pair of binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: JASON SHAW

customer_reviews.title: Birthday Present
customer_reviews.text: purchased for my 8 year old grandson and he absolutely loved it. Found the moon and jupiter the first night and the next day was zoned in on some birds and distant towers. Great buy. A good beginner scope.
customer_reviews.author: Linda G. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: The star finder does not work very well and it is very in accurate. The lensing had some distortion to it. Very lightweight and easy to port but the backpack is extremely cheap. The tripod is flimsy. But for the price and being a travel piece it’s not bad.
customer_reviews.author: TomlinStar

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Newbie to telescopes, and this one had good reviews for a starter. Was hoping to see more than just the moon in any kind of detail, and this one had a few reviews saying you could see Saturn's rings...not even close. Now, I didn't plan on being able to do that anytime soon, but come on! The moon looks decent, but forget about any details on planets. And the tripod is low quality. Screws don't tighten enough to hold telescope in any position other than total horizontal, so when we are looking up, the scope slllooowwwly lowers down to horizontal. Frustrating. Good for nature viewing, but that's it.
customer_reviews.author: Janette S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little scope though a Barlow would have been nice.
customer_reviews.text: More a spotter scope than an astronomy scope but it is good for portability and entry level. The max mag out of the box is too low for planetary observation but deep sky objects are fine and the lunar surface. The tripod is segmented so you can easily use on a tabletop or extend to stand on the ground. Alt-azimuth is rudimentary but a little smoother than other scopes in this price range. Comes with a backpack which makes this an excellent portability solution.
customer_reviews.author: Jaycee

customer_reviews.title: It was extremely easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 year old daughter as a Christmas gift. It’s all she really wanted. It was extremely easy to assemble. And easy to use. The backpack it comes with is amazing as well. She LOVES it. Only thing I would say about it is the tripod isn’t that great. I’m definitely going to be purchasing a better tripod before we take it out. But I’d buy it again and would recommend it anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: This telescope is impossible to get focused even in almost total darkness.
customer_reviews.author: James and Stephani

customer_reviews.title: Good Beginner Scope
customer_reviews.text: Fair starter telescope. Tri-Pod is not very good,flimsey. Needs 2 control knobs and the alt/azimith dials roll back when you try to adjust them for accuracy. The optics are good. A good "point and Shoot" beginning telescope.
customer_reviews.author: Duke Ritter

customer_reviews.title: Best pics
customer_reviews.text: I get this out on the pink moon and and strawberry moon and have gotten the best pics with my phone on the eye piece
customer_reviews.author: Ray Web

customer_reviews.title: This telescope is worth the money, even after replacing the tripod
customer_reviews.text: I used this telescope with a filter to watch the 2017 solar eclipse and was not disappointed. With the filter, I watched the sun spots traverse the sun surface for several days before the eclipse with good clarity. I actually bought a really nice tripod to replace the low-quality one that comes with the telescope and a solar filter to watch the 2017 eclipse, but I didnt mind, because the telescope was so inexpensive to begin with. All of the equipment fits neatly in the backpack that came with the telescope.
customer_reviews.author: kocajj

customer_reviews.title: Perfect First Telescope
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to be the first telescope I have ever own. I am immensely satisfied with it, having used it about 9 times now I have totally mastered the mechanics and can assembly in 5 minutes and aim at objects with relative ease. Jupiter's moons and Saturn's rings are visible with this scope. It is super light to boot. Overall this is an excellent product that I recommend for anyone in a position similar to myself, looking to buy a first scope.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Spend more, get better.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a light, portable scope to take in the camper. I read all the reviews before buying this one. It is made of mostly plastic parts, which is okay, and the tri-pod is very flimsy, which is mostly annoying. What confuses me are the reviews that say the functional quality is good. Seriously? For daytime birdwatching it's fine, but for stargazing it's pretty much useless, no better than my eye alone. Spend the extra money and get a real one.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Kstr

customer_reviews.title: Fine Scope, Bad Mount
customer_reviews.text: The telescope itself seems fine and very easy to setup and breakdown, however, the tripod that comes in this kit is massively frustrating. The motion of the tripod mount is very jerky and it's impossible to do fine adjustments, anything farther than the moon is extremely difficult to get centered in the view. If you want to actually use this telescope as more than a toy, you'll find yourself replacing the tripod very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Rick M.

customer_reviews.title: Oh, it's portable, but...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an easily portable scope to take with me when I travel. It is portable, but the focus knob broke the second time I used it. Now it is just a piece of junk that is now part of the clutter of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Good telescope
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to assemble, but good quality telescope for the price. I think most people, especially kids, don't understand how poor the heavens are to view even with a telescope. The computer images that are so beautiful often have a caption stating artists interpretation. Meaning they are elaborate paintings based on technical data from $billion satellite. Camping in the woods on a clear night during a meteor shower is the best way to go at enjoy the night sky.
customer_reviews.author: Gumby

customer_reviews.title: Keep out of reach of small strong children
customer_reviews.text: My 11 yr old loves her telescope! So did my 2 yr old! Daddy has another project on his honey-do list! It worked great and had excellent distance! We watched the stars and the planets and enjoyed our summer evenings...until one night little bam-bam decided he needed a club and broke the pin! It is fixable with a well placed screw...but item is not child-proof!
customer_reviews.author: Val (Bubbles)

customer_reviews.title: Multiple use for it and not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginners and kids. I bought a few attachments to setup my dslr nikon d3400 and another eye piece 8mm and took theses photos. The images without the camera was a bit more clear with the 10mm but I was unable to capture it as such. More practice I need. If you want to use a camera you're gonna need a stronger tripod. For the price It is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to figure out how to focus on anything.
customer_reviews.text: Still haven't figured out how to focus on anything and I bought it months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Littlejohn

customer_reviews.title: Get a better one.
customer_reviews.text: First telescope I ordered didn't come with the tripod. And I didn't have any others I could spare. Design was hyper-flimsy. Felt very very cheap. Sent it back. Received another one. Tripod broke instantly. Lesson learned, even for a travel scope, don't ever pay under triple digits. This is "department store at christmas" quality. I went with a Celestron C-90 spotter scope instead. Works way better.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Too easy bump it and you have to wait for it ...
customer_reviews.text: Have used this many times. My only real issue is how shakey the stand is. Too easy bump it and you have to wait for it to settle before you can see what your looking for. This includes when your seeing it up. But once you get it set up this works fine as a family back yard telescope. Nice and compact so we have taken it with us camping twice.
customer_reviews.author: melody bishop

customer_reviews.title: but I have a couple of decent tripods and the scope mounts to them just fine. I plan on attaching my DSLR for terrestrial ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself and just checked it out. Everything is as advertised. IMO the tripod is worthless, but I have a couple of decent tripods and the scope mounts to them just fine. I plan on attaching my DSLR for terrestrial photos. Best features - nice clear optics, very easy to put together, very light for trips, very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Fergie

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Omg this is a toy, I tried several times and ways, nothing shows, You can see more with your eyes directly than with this thing. It shows absolutely nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana delfi

customer_reviews.title: Can't see anything
customer_reviews.text: The only object you can see is the moon. Not good for viewing planets. I tried looking at jupiter today. Can't see anything. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: KP21

customer_reviews.title: Have not been able to see anything with this
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for his birthday as he asked for a telescope for some time. He was very excited when he opened and for the first few days it was cloudy and overcast. Once it finally cleared up we went out to try to use. We have yet to see anything with this telescope. I thought maybe it was how he put it together and had him pull it apart and redo but still nothing. Not sure what to do with it now.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. Piece of plastic junk. Screws stripped on initial assembly. Absolute waste of your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great telescope for a gift for a budding astronomer of any age.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my mom. She said it looked like a great scope for beginners and was quite pleased with the backpack and weight for portability. She feels it an excellent telescope for this price range, so I feel it made an excellent gift. She said it looked like it would be easy to set up as well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Morgenson

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to use telescope that can easily be carried around. There is one spot that the tilting adjuster doesn’t cover so you have to either hold or move your telescope if you need that exact spot. Overall, it’s a great price and a good telescope for beginners. I took these photos by holding my phone up to the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Nick SD

customer_reviews.title: Ok for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad little telescope, but don't expect super close-ups of the moon (you can see craters pretty well) or distant planets. Assembly was easy. Finding and focusing on an object is a bit tricky. I shouldn't complain for the price, but the telescope definitely feels cheap, because it was. My wife enjoys it, so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Sanford

customer_reviews.title: granddaughter is very happy with the gift
customer_reviews.text: Delivery - on time. The packaging is beautiful. good quality thank
customer_reviews.author: Alla Serebro

customer_reviews.title: Can’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: Well this one was a disappointment for us. For some reason we can’t see anything in the way you are supposed to. You can see the sky but in a basic way... We can’t get it to focus on anything! Now it’s possible we are using it incorrectly but I doubt it. The good thing is that it is small and light weight to travel with, love the back pack it comes with. Overall I have to say I wouldn’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Hey Hey

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this.
customer_reviews.text: I just wasted 90 bucks on this telescope. I bought it for my son's bday, we cannot see anything. day or night , it just dont work We followed the instructions, I have watched youtube vids, read on google but this just doesn't work. To make things worse the window for return closed. I'm so disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Brendita

customer_reviews.title: Buy a telescope and enjoy the great beyond.
customer_reviews.text: Now that I have time to look to the skie this is a great way to do that. As far as I can tell this is a great telescope. I then purchased a phone mount and I've been able to take great pictures of the moon and Mars. Plus I was able to take a fantastic video of the moon appearing to pass by.
customer_reviews.author: scooter o

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely loved this!
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best scope for beginners that I have found for my child. We have had several in the past that do not even come close to how beautiful and detailed the image reflected is. I ordered a second one for a friend because it was a great deal! I will try to attach a picture, however it is grainy. My kiddo was holding the phone to eyepiece. The picture does NOT do the actual naked eye image in the scope justice.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Only used a couple times and now focus knob doesn’t work! Don’t buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Item
customer_reviews.text: I received a faulty telescope. The knob to bring images into focus is broken so all images are just blurry blobs.
customer_reviews.author: IamG

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for Christmas. The people we bought it for have been happy with and and have told us about the things they've seen with it. So far they've enjoyed it and have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: stungazed

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel, great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This travel scope really lives up to its name. It's light, durable, and easily packed. I bought this scope with the idea of studying the moon, and perhaps being able to see our closer planets a little better. At 40x magnification, I know it's not going to get me much farther than that. But it came at a good price point, and will give me an idea of how much I would use a telescope before I invest in something a little more powerful and expensive. Assembly was easy. My only concern is that, fully extended, the tripod might be too light to hold up in more than a light breeze without manual stabilization.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Seems Ok.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a nice inexpensive telescope. My Grandson was really excited to get it for his 4th Birthday Sunday, the day it arrived. We tried to set it up, but the screw part that connects the telescope to the tripod is not a threaded part. So apparently someone put the wrong part in the base or the part wasn't threaded in manufacturing. Will update when we try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Boyer

customer_reviews.title: The best gift I could have given my 10 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: The best gift I could have given my 10 year old son! I am so pleased with my purchase. This travel scope is quite nice, and especially for children of all ages and certainly if they're just in the beginning stages. It was really cool that it came with a travel backpack as well.
customer_reviews.author: Vintage Soul

customer_reviews.title: I ordered as reward for hitting goals
customer_reviews.text: The girls got to chose which Telescope they wanted to receive. We have an astronomy club at our council. So these girls wanted to be able to view the galaxys and stars. I really have no idea why each girl chose the one they did; but I have had NO complaints so BONUS!! LOL:)
customer_reviews.author: GSTOP

customer_reviews.title: You won’t see the Great Red Spot
customer_reviews.text: Everything looks like a white ball.... looked at all visible planets and there are no apparent colors.... not even close to what was promised good for moon and closer but not much else.... looked at Jupiter and Mars last night both looked the same.... white circles
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery perfect for a 10 year old bday gift thank you
customer_reviews.author: xochilt

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners, for landscapes only though!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great portable telescope, my only complaint is that it doesn’t cover the distance it claims. Otherwise, really cool for beginners. We primarily use it to observe landscapes, if you want to use it for constellations or the moon, you’d be dissatisfied
customer_reviews.author: Colin Corbett

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: After using this for awhile, I wish I spent more. It’s not very powerful and the base is not good,too shaky,hard to lock on target. I would think this is ok for a kid but don’t recommend for an adult beginner. Spend a little more money if you like looking at the night sky.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Oleksiak

customer_reviews.title: Nice telescope
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas gift for a family member. Looked nice after put together. Nice for the stargazer in your family.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley R

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very good for beginners but pretty stiff to adjust when trying to scan the sky or ocean but it does work good and clear for the money
customer_reviews.author: Robert Saagim

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: . Could not get any type of view. Blurry lights and nothing more.
customer_reviews.author: The D fam

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Please do not wast your money on this I got it for Christmas for my son who is 17 year old and he was not able to see anything. He googled and read the instructions still nothing. I mean I didn't expect to see very in depth but at least some stars.
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I know nothing about telescopes but my daughter requested one so I got this because it was on sale and had good reviews. Definitely happy! It has a great adjustable stand and it came with a back pack you can put it in! Also there was a dvd included about the stars!
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit...haven't seen the details of the moon this well since the ONE super moon I saw.
customer_reviews.text: As with any Photo equipment, cheap stands aren't that stable. The passing traffic makes the whole thing shake beyond clear visibility. You deff want to set your site, let it still itself and look, without touching. Or add a light sandbag to stabilize the stand.
customer_reviews.author: PauliGMac

customer_reviews.title: Great scope but worthless table tripod
customer_reviews.text: If you're an amateur astronomer and looking for a larger finder than a 50mm for your scope, look no further. This one is great quality and takes standard 1-1/4" diameter eyepieces! You'll need a bracket to attach this little 70mm scope to your main instrument though. The supplied tripod isn't worth the powder to blow it to kingdom come but the finder itself is worth every penny. Get the proper large enough bracket for the tube and you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: JB (South Florida)

customer_reviews.title: Entry level telescope
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wanting a telescope for a while. This one is alright, the build feels a little cheap and the tripod is garbage, but I’ve had some nice moments looking out at different places. The bag is nice and I could see this as a good guy to take on hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Santi F.

customer_reviews.title: Get a separate tripod.
customer_reviews.text: For the money you're paying it's a pretty great telescope. It's small and really easy to carry with the backpack. As you'll see in other reviews, the tripod is pretty useless, it's super short and not very stable. It looking through the telescope a difficult process. But the telescope itself is great, really clear picture even with frost on the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Nakashima

customer_reviews.title: Gave this as gift
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift to my nephew and he uses it often and loves looking at the moon and other objects in the night sky. I would recommend this for anyone looking into starting the hobby or a child that is curious about the heavens.
customer_reviews.author: S campos

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very poor Quality! Tripod has fallen apart with 1-2 uses. Lenses fell out on the third use when the last leg gave way and scope fell to the ground. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mcguigan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for his birthday, it came fast, it came nicely packaged and the material quality is very good for a first telescope. But we love that it's lightweight and easy to move around. Very excited to take this out camping!
customer_reviews.author: Caneshia e.

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit for the price
customer_reviews.text: Lots of value here for the price. Great starter kit. I just purchased it to try and get some eclipse photos and knew I didn't need much but was surprised at the decent quality for a low price. I purchased a cell phone camera mount for this as well so now when I see any delinquents across the street causing trouble I can video and shoot pictures of them 300 yards away and they won't even know it.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Sanford

product_meta.title: Celestron - 70mm Travel Scope - Portable Refractor Telescope - Fully-Coated Glass Optics - Ideal Telescope for Beginners - BONUS Astronomy Software Package
product_meta.description:
Designed with American innovation for beginner stargazers, the Celestron Travel Scope 70 is a professionally engineered refractor telescope that is perfect for celestial or terrestrial viewing on the go. It’s the perfect telescope for adults and kids to use together with its fully-coated, high-quality glass optics, including a refractor-style 70mm objective lens. The aperture allows high-resolution viewing, without adding a lot of extra weight. Added coating on the 70mm lens allows light to enter, providing sharper, crisper viewing of celestial and terrestrial objects during the day or at night.

The Celestron telescope for beginners is designed with several operating features that make it exceptionally user-friendly. Our precision manufacturing standards and high-quality materials are unmatched in the industry. We’ve included two quality eyepieces (20mm and 10mm) and a star diagonal for crisp low- and high-power viewing during the day or at night, allowing you to enjoy close-ups of wildlife in nature or stargaze with family and friends.

The Celestron Travel Scope 70 weighs just 3.3 pounds and assembles in seconds with no tools required. It’s easy to use to navigate the sky. When your observing session is over, everything packs up into the handy included traveling backpack.

Your purchase also entitles you to a FREE download of Celestron’s BONUS Starry Night Astronomy Software with information on thousands of celestial objects, printable sky maps, and more. It’s the best way to learn about the night sky and plan your next observing session.
feature_bullets: SUPERIOR OPTICS: The Celestron 70mm Travel Scope features high-quality, fully-coated glass optics, a potent 70mm objective lens, a lightweight frame, and a custom backpack to carry it all. Its quality is unmatched in its class and against competitors.

POWERFUL EYEPIECES FOR UP-CLOSE VIEWING: Our telescope for astronomy beginners is equipped with two high-quality eyepieces (20mm and 10mm) that provide low- and high-power views of celestial objects at night and terrestrial objects during the day.

LARGE 70MM OBJECTIVE LENS: Our refractor telescope is equipped with a large 70mm aperture objective lens that provides enhanced, brighter views compared to the 50mm model while adding very little additional weight. Setting up and using the Travel Scope is quick and easy.

BONUS BAG, TRIPOD, AND SOFTWARE: This Celestron telescope and full-height tripod can be taken anywhere in the included travel backpack. Accessories also include a FREE download of one of the top consumer rated astronomy software programs.

UNBEATABLE WARRANTY AND CUSTOMER SUPPORT: Buy with confidence from the world’s #1 telescope brand, based in California since 1960. You’ll also receive a two-year warranty and unlimited access to technical support from our team of US-based experts.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars4,056 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
